title: Celebrated Italian fashion designer Valentino dies aged 93
byline: Valentino Garavani, the jet-set Italian designer whose high-glamour gowns — often in his trademark shade of “Valentino red” — were fashion show staples for nearly half a century, has died at home in Rome, his foundation announced Monday. He was 93.

title: Trump says he will ‘100%’ carry out Greenland tariffs threat, as EU vows to protect its interests
byline: Donald Trump has vowed to “100%” follow through on his threat to impose tariffs on European countries who oppose his demand to take control of Greenland.

title: Mainly dry weather expected in most parts of the island today
byline: Mainly dry weather will prevail in the most parts of the island, today (20), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Police introduce contact numbers to provide information for systematic anti-narcotics operations in 2026
byline: With the commencement of the New Year, the Sri Lanka Police have introduced a dedicated and streamlined mechanism enabling the public to directly provide information to Divisional Officers-in-Charge (OICs) regarding the distribution of illicit narcotics across the island.

title: Five suspects including woman arrested over Jinthupitiya shooting
byline: Five suspects, including a woman, have been arrested in connection with the shooting incident in Jinthupitiya, which resulted in the death of one person and caused injuries to two small children on 16 January, 2026.

title: Heavy snow in US strands drivers in 100-vehicle crash
byline: Law enforcement officials said on Monday (Jan 19) that they were working to clear roads after a 100-vehicle crash occurred on snow-blanketed roads in the northern state of Michigan.

title: Suspect arrested with over Rs. 283 mln, two vehicles in Ibbagamuwa
byline: A suspect has been arrested under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act with Rs. 283,300,000 in cash and two vehicles suspected to have been illegally acquired.

title: Last-minute revision in Grade 6 English language module carried out without proper methodology: Minister Bimal
byline: It has been revealed that a last-minute revision to the Grade 6 English language module introduced under the new education reforms was carried out without following the proper methodology.

title: Cold weather triggers rise in viral infections across Sri Lanka - Health experts
byline: Health authorities have reported an increase in the spread of several viral diseases coinciding with the prevailing cold weather conditions in Sri Lanka.

title: UK to consult on social media ban for under 16s
byline: The British government will consult on whether social media should be banned for under-16s in the UK.

title: Sri Lanka’s proposed counterterrorism law risks further abuses – HRW
byline: The Sri Lanka government’s proposed counterterrorism legislation includes numerous provisions similar to the current abusive law and risks facilitating the same kind of repression, Human Rights Watch (HRW) said today.

title: Trump threatens 200% tariffs on French wines to get Macron to join ‘Board of Peace’
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said he will impose a 200% tariff on French wines and champagnes, a move he claimed would push French President Emmanuel Macron to join Trump’s Board of Peace initiative aimed at resolving global conflicts.

title: Govt earned Rs. 904 bln from vehicle imports, more than double the expected income
byline: The government has generated a total income of Rs. 904 billion from vehicle imports, significantly surpassing the initially projected target of Rs. 441 billion.

title: At least 13 children killed in school bus crash in South Africa
byline: Preliminary reports indicate 11 schoolchildren died at the scene, with two others succumbing to their injuries later in hospital.

title: Trump to meet global CEOs in Davos, with US policy in spotlight
byline: Donald Trump is expected to meet global business leaders in Davos on Wednesday, sources familiar with the matter said, as the U.S. President’s presence looms large over the annual gathering of the global elite in Switzerland.

title: Ex-ministers Mahindananda and Nalin Fernando’s appeals fixed for hearing
byline: The Supreme Court today (20) fixed a date for the hearing of the appeals filed by former ministers Mahindananda Aluthgamage and Nalin Fernando against their convictions on corruption charges.

title: Chinese companies ready to invest in dairy farms and agri produce in Sri Lanka
byline: The Chinese Chamber of Commerce has announced plans to invest in Sri Lanka. The proposed investments aim to utilise unused land in the country to develop large-scale dairy farms and export-oriented agricultural products, including vegetables and fruits.

title: Sajith vows to ensure justice for foreign employment scam victims
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa has stated that he intends to re-submit facts to the Parliament regarding a major scam in which over 640 individuals were allegedly defrauded by two foreign employment agencies.

title: Sri Lanka Police expresses gratitude for UAE’s continued support in combating transnational crimes
byline: Sri Lanka Police has expressed its sincere appreciation to the Government of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and its relevant authorities for their cooperation in the successful deportation of three wanted suspects to Sri Lanka on January 15.

title: Commemorative medal issued for Sri Lanka Navy’s 75th Anniversary
byline: A new commemorative medal has been introduced in view of the 75th anniversary of the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: Baseline Road Extension Project set to resume
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to implement the third phase of the Baseline Road Extension Project.

title: 13 apprehended for harvesting sea cucumber illegally in seas off Kilinochchi
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has apprehended 13 individuals engaged in night diving to illegally harvest sea cucumbers during a search operation conducted in the Walaipadu sea area in Kilinochchi.

title: Ex-commando arrested with 3 homemade grenades in Anuradhapura
byline: The Anuradhapura Divisional Criminal Investigation Division has recovered three locally-manufactured grenades from a house in the Matale Junction area in Anuradhapura.

title: Taylor Swift label UMG inks licensing deal with China’s NetEase Cloud Music
byline: U.S.-based Universal Music Group struck a deal with Chinese music streaming service NetEase Cloud Music, the two music companies announced Monday.

title: Spain begins 3 days of mourning for deadly train wreck while death toll ticks up to 41
byline: Spain woke to flags at half staff on Tuesday as the nation began three days of mourning for the victims of the deadly train accident in the country’s south, while emergency crews continued to pull bodies from the wreckage.

title: Businessman arrested at BIA while attempting to smuggle ‘Kush’
byline: A Sri Lankan businessman has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to smuggle a consignment of ‘Kush’ cannabis, with an estimated street value of Rs. 1 million, into the country.

title: Opposition Leader rejects govt-proposed dates for no-confidence debate against PM
byline: Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa stated that the government is prepared to debate the no-confidence motion scheduled to be brought by the opposition against Prime Minister and Education Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya on January 22 and 23.

title: Cabinet greenlights wage hike and relief scheme for plantation sector
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the relief measures proposed in the 2026 Budget to improve the living standards of plantation workers.

title: Cabinet approves amendments to pension provisions of state employees recruited after Jan. 2016
byline: Cabinet approval has been granted to amend the provisions regarding pension entitlements in the appointment letters of state employees recruited after January 1, 2016.

title: Suspect arrested over shooting of Thusitha Halloluwa’s vehicle
byline: A suspect has been arrested in connection with a shooting incident targeting the vehicle carrying former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB) Thusitha Halloluwa and two others in Narahenpita in May 2025.

title: All three generators of Norochcholai Power plant reconnected to national grid
byline: All generators of the Norochcholai Lakvijaya Power Plant, which had been temporarily shut down due to maintenance work, have now been restored to normal operation.

title: Petition filed by Balangoda Kassapa Thero fixed for hearing at Appeals Court
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered that the writ petition seeking the annulment of the order issued by the Trincomalee Magistrate’s Court to remand two Buddhist monks, including Venerable Balangoda Kassapa Thero, be taken up for consideration on January 22.

title: Private sector minimum wage increased to Rs. 30,000
byline: The minimum wage of employees in the private sector has been increased by Rs. 3,000, with effect from January 01.

title: ‘Prize awarded by independent Nobel committee, not Norwegian govt’: Norway PM responds to Trump’s message
byline: Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store confirmed that he received a message from US President Donald Trump, expressing grievance over the Nobel Peace Prize snub, which has altered his approach to global affairs and alliance politics.

title: Education reforms have not been discontinued: Cabinet Spokesman
byline: The government is taking steps to keep the public and all stakeholders informed about the new education reforms, Cabinet Spokesperson Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa stated.

title: Two Sri Lankans arrested after Male airport brawl
byline: Two Sri Lankan nationals have been arrested in connection with a brawl at Male Velana International Airport in the Maldives.

title: Sri Lanka’s economic growth to slow down in 2026 and 2027: World Bank
byline: Sri Lanka’s economic growth is expected to slow down in 2026 and 2027, according to the World Bank’s latest projection.

title: Colombo HC schedules evidence hearing in Champika Ranawaka’s Rajagiriya accident case
byline: The Colombo High Court today (20) scheduled the next hearing for February 12 in the case filed against three defendants, including former Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka over a 2016 car accident.

title: Rs. 380 million recovered from foreign employment scams returned to victims
byline: A discussion was held between officers of the Enforcement Division of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) and Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment, Arun Hemachandra today (20).

title: Kerala High Court orders repatriation of two Sri Lankan siblings detained for two years
byline: The Kerala High Court recently directed authorities to take immediate steps to facilitate the return of two Sri Lankan nationals, including a minor, who had been detained in a transit home in Kollam for more than two years despite not being accused in any criminal case.

title: Cabinet approves signing MoU to establish Indian Ocean Coastal Alliance
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to a proposal to sign a Memorandum of Understanding to establish the Indian Ocean Coastal Alliance, with the objectives of enhancing cooperation among member countries to improve the livelihoods of fisheries communities and ensuring the sustainable management of fisheries resources in the region.

title: Ratnapura logs highest temperature for second consecutive day
byline: The highest temperature in the country today (20) was recorded from the Ratnapura Meteorological Station at 34.2°C, the Department of Meteorology noted.

title: Schools that were closed for A/L exams to reopen tomorrow
byline: The second phase of the first school term for the 2026 academic year in government and government-approved private schools is scheduled to commence tomorrow (21), according to the Ministry of Education.

title: Government Radiologic Technologists to stage token strike tomorrow
byline: The Government Radiological Technologists’ Association has announced that the token strike scheduled for tomorrow (21) will proceed as planned.

title: Late Nandana Gunathilake to be laid to rest tomorrow
byline: he burial of the late Nandana Gunathilake is set to take place following a decision taken by his family.

title: Teachers’ salary increase approved under 2025 Budget proposals credited to accounts
byline: The increased teachers’ salaries, implemented from January 1, 2026, proposed through the 2025 Budget, have been credited to respective accounts today (20), the Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education has announced.

title: UN Human Rights Council to hold emergency session on Iran
byline: The UN Human Rights Council will hold an emergency session on Iran on Friday (Jan 23), with proponents aiming to discuss “alarming violence” used against protesters, a document showed on Tuesday.

title: Lonely Planet highlights 13 must-visit beaches across Sri Lanka
byline: Renowned travel guide Lonely Planet has highlighted 13 must-visit beaches across Sri Lanka, showcasing the island’s diverse and picturesque coastline that continues to attract visitors from around the world.

title: CPC introduces digital fuel card system for state vehicles
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has introduced a new digital fuel card system to make the process of supplying fuel to state-owned vehicles more efficient and transparent.

title: Donald Trump calls UK’s Chagos deal with Mauritius ‘stupid’ and ‘weak’
byline: US President Donald Trump has described the UK’s deal to hand the Chagos Islands to Mauritius and lease back a key military base as an “act of great stupidity”, months after he endorsed the move.

title: Sri Lanka to send 1,000 caregivers to Israel in 2026
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has decided to send around 1,000 Sri Lankans to fill domestic caregiver vacancies in Israel in 2026.

title: BASL expresses concern over social media posts targeting Attorney General
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has expressed its concern regarding recent posts circulating on social media targeting the Attorney General.
